article: It was a Sunday evening, and everyone was doing their own thing --whatever my sisters and I like to do during our _ time. Mom told us to come to the living room. Like most children, of course, we wanted to _ whatever we were doing. I don't remember _ I was doing, only that I was the last one to go into the _ room. Abbey was in a chair, and Elizabeth was by the wall, closest _ the stairs. I don't remember where everyone else was sitting, _ it was one of the very few times my Dad was with us while we had _ . He is usually at work or always busy with something. Mom told us that they were getting a _ When she first told us, I didn't know what to think. But when Elizabeth started laughing, all my sisters and I started _ , because we truly thought she was joking, or maybe we just didn't _ Elizabeth to get mad at us. Looking back, I think the main _ I laughed with them was because I didn't _ what to think. Mom insisted that she wasn't _ , and that she wouldn't joke about something serious; for we wouldn't _ her if something of the sort would _ happen. We all stopped laughing, and Elizabeth was the first to get _ She was angry that they were getting a divorce. She went upstairs in _ , and then I also got upset. I don't really remember much _ Elizabeth went upstairs, but I know that I _ the living room so I could be _ . How I wish every person had an entire family!
